questions.question: Calculate the simple interest if the principal amount is 50000 and the rate is 2% for 4 years.
Find the Compound Interest on Rs. 1000 for two years at 2% per annum.
Evaluate the compound interest on Rs. 10101 for 3 years at the rate of 9% per annum compounded annually.
Vidhya lent Rs. 5000 to Kavya for 3 years at the rate of 5% per annum compound interest. Calculate the amount that Vidhya will get after 3 years.
A farmer gets a loan of Rs. 100000 against his fixed deposits. If the rate of interest is 1.5 paise per rupee per annum, calculate the compound interest payable after 2 years.
Calculate the compound interest at the rate of 6% per annum for 2 years on the principal, which in 2 years at the rate of 2% per annum gives Rs. 8000 as simple interest.
Compute the compound interest on Rs. 16000 for 2 years 10% per annum when compounded half yearly.
Find the amount on Rs. 5000 at the rate of 20% per annum for 18 months when interest is compounded half yearly.
If the amount is Rs. 400 and Principal is Rs. 100 which is compounded half yearly for 1 year, calculate the rate of interest.
Calculate the compound interest on Rs. 4000 for 2 years at 20% per annum when compounded half yearly.
The population of a city is increasing at the rate of 10% per annum. Calculate the population of the city on this basis after 3 years if the current population is 10000.
The population of the town is 30000. The annual birth rate is 5% and the annual death rate is 3%. Calculate the population after 2 years.
The population of a village was 10000 four years ago. If it had increased by 2%, 10%, 5%, 4% in last four years. Find the present population of the village.
The population of a sate decreases every year at the rate 4% per annum. The population of the state 3 years ago was 150000. Find present population.
If the population of a city has been increasing at the rate of 10%. The present population of the city is 9680000. Find its population 2 years ago.
The production of spare parts rose to 25000 from 16000 in 2 years. Find the rate of growth per annum.

The bacteria in a culture grows by 5% in the first hour, decreases by 10% in the second hour and increases by 2% in the third hour. If the original count of the bacteria is 50000, Calculate the count of bacteria at the end of 3 hours.

Manish opened a cafe with an initial investment of Rs. 64000. In the first year he incurred the loss of 10%. During second year he gained the profit of 4% and in the third year he gained the profit of 15%. Calculate his net profit gained in the entire three years.

900 workers were employed to construct a dam in four years. At the end of first year, 5% workers were retrenched. At the end of the second year 2% of the workers were retrenched. To complete the construction in time, the number of workers were increased to 10% at the end of third year. How many workers were working at the end of fourth year.
An engine has initially 8000 litre oil. The amount of oil has to be increased at the rate of 10% every year. Find the time-period at the end of which the amount of oil becomes 9261 litre.
A company increased the production of cars from 15625 in 2002 to 27000 in 2005. Find the annual rate of growth of production of the cars.
Fe-57 decays at the constant rate in such a way that it reduces to 50% in 5568 years. Find the age of an old rod which the iron (Fe) is only 12.5% of the original.
The present population of a village is 10000. If it increases at the rate of 2% per annum, find the population after 2 years.
The initial population of a country is 1000000. If the birth rate and the death rate is 10% and 4% respectively, then find the population of the country after 2 years.
Two years ago the population of a village was 4000. If the annual increase during the two successive years be at the rate of 2% & 4%, find the present population.
The annual rate of growth in population of a certain city is 10%. If its present population is 532400, find the population 3 years ago.
Vidhya started a business with initial investment of 500000. She incurred a loss of 2% in the first year and in the second year she gained the profit of 10%. Calculate her net profit earned.
An apartment of two floors is constructed at the cost of Rs. 5000000. It is depreciating at the rate of 20% per annum. Find its value 3 years after construction.
A new two-wheeler costs Rs. 90000. Its price depreciates at the rate of 10% a year during first two years and the rate of 25% a year thereafter. Find the cost of the two-wheeler after 3 years.
The present price of a cycle is Rs 8000. If its value is decreasing every year by 10% then find the price before 3 years.
The value of a gadget worth Rs.10000 is depreciating at the rate of 10% per annum. In how many years will its value be reduced to Rs 6561?
The value of a land increases every year at the rate of 8%. If its value at the end of 3 years be Rs 6000000, find its original value at the beginning of these years.
Max bought a gadget for Rs. 24000. If the cost of the gadget after 2 years depreciates to Rs. 20757.60, find the rate of depreciation.
What is the compound interest on ₹5000 for 1.5 years at 8% per annum, compounded half-yearly?
A sum of money triples itself at compound interest in 8 years. In how many years will it become 9 times itself?
A sum of money on compound interest amounts to Rs.10648 in 3 years and Rs.9680 in 2 years. The rate of interest per annum is:
At what rate per annum will Rs.32000 yield a compound interest of Rs.5044 in 9 months interest being compounded quarterly?
The compound interest on Rs.16,000 for 9 months at 20% per annum, interest being compounded quarterly, is
A sum of Rs.8000 will amount to Rs.8820 in 2 years if the interest is calculated every year. The rate of compound interest is
The compound interest on Rs.30,000 at 7% per annum for a certain time is Rs.4,347. The time is
